intro: Scabiosa palaestina, commonly known as the Palestine mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Middle East and parts of Europe. It belongs to the Caprifoliaceae family and is characterized by its clusters of small, pink or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are upright and branching. Scabiosa palaestina is often found in mountainous regions and is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical medicinal uses.
